ok i just meant to merge voteehome to the main branch cause I made a bunch of front end changes in there, but ill take a look at voting branch again

steps to merge are:

*Commit all changes
git checkout develop
git pull
git checkout myCoolBranch
git merge develop
*resolve merge conflicts

git checkout develop
git merge myCoolBranch
git push
perfect. thanks

Keep in mind that if you do have merge conflicts, you need to run
git add .
git commit
after fixing the conflicts

develop now has some end to end tests that can be used as examples for anyone interested.

tests are located under ``tests/e2e/``
tests are run with ``gulp e2e.test``

<@U0J3A5RML>, thanks for that

I would like to mention what I found out to be wrong with the submitting a vote - maybe one of you can take it from there and figure it out. 

Essentially, all the action happens in the server-side `questions.js` controller in function `vote`

This function is responsible for saving a vote cast by a user. The problem is the following: 

`answer.save()` where `answer` is an instance of `Answer` schema object does not save the object in the model. 

In fact, there is no collection for Answers. Calling save() should, in theory, create one, but this does not happen.
I have been looking at it, but I'm not too familiar with everything so I haven't had any luck. Is the answer schema the only one with extend?
yes, it is, but I found that extend has no effect on this
And it doesn't need to be a package either correct?
that didn’t help either
what branch is the most up to date with all the vote submission/answers stuff
Haha okay. Well I have been researching it for a while, I will let you know if I find anything helpful
I want to pull an update

<@U0HV4EBMJ>: submitAnswer. It doesn’t not have my modifications, but they are irrelevant. I can push them to a new branch if you are interested

<@U0J3D11K5>: this is what I am doing right now
yes, I do have a viable solution.
nice

There is an error when I hit `answers.save()` 

Here it is: 

```render: [Function] } { [ValidationError: Answer validation failed]
  message: 'Answer validation failed',
  name: 'ValidationError',
  errors: 
   { created: 
      { [CastError: Cast to Date failed for value "function now() { [native code] }" at path "created"]
        message: 'Cast to Date failed for value "function now() { [native code] }" at path "created"',
        name: 'CastError',
        kind: 'Date',
        value: [Function: now],
        path: 'created',
        reason: undefined } } }```
thats the code for recording when date/time the answer is submitted
there should be a line somewhere that is type casting date when it should be saving as an array I believe
I had used Date.now to set the created for the new answer object
yes, that is exactly what is happening - you can set it, but it won’t be saved in the DB
if you set it to Date.now
strange. Okay but the default is set to Date.now, so will it work that way or still cause issues?
if you don’t set it when creating a new Answer object, it fails with the same problem
but now at least we know what’s up
oh okay but still a good find!
It looks to me like Date.now isn't being called.
It's trying to cast to a Date object but it has a function. What happens if you replace 'Date.now' with 'Date.now()'
same thing
just tried it
odd.
trying new Date().getTime()
solved it
and while doing that I also figured out how to authorize REST requests
Fantasti
hooray!
c

<@U0J3A5RML>, you will not believe this. Remember we had no clue what to do with the token? It turns out that you have to authorize your requests like this: 

In your request Header, you put ‘authorization’ as you key and ```Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.JTdCJTIyX192JTIyOjAsJTIyZW1haWwlMjI6JTIycHJvZjFAZ21haWwuY29tJTIyLCUyMnVzZXJuYW1lJTIyOiUyMnByb2YlMjIsJTIybmFtZSUyMjolMjJMZXZrbyUyMiwlMjJfaWQlMjI6JTIyNTZjZjlhNWRlMjZmOTk4OGFhNWUwOThlJTIyLCUyMnByb3ZpZGVyJTIyOiUyMmxvY2FsJTIyLCUyMnJvbGVzJTIyOiU1QiUyMnByb2Zlc3NvciUyMiwlMjJhdXRoZW50aWNhdGVkJTIyJTVEJTdE.wEmEYbpa84zF0JW_Yu6H2kjFmATi_8KPY_L6tn3z2-k``` as your value
where that random string is your token
That's unintuitive.
we were missing two things here: 1) the ‘authorization’ being the key, 2) token being proceeded by the `Bearer ` string.
I know
it is frankly ridiculous
but that is how browser authenticates
which is where I took it from - a browser request header :simple_smile:
reverse-engineer my ass...
as for answers ...

For those who listened to today lecture about static testing: we actually do have this facility and it is called `jshint`
you can run it by typing `gulp jshint`
it is also executed every time you change a file with a server running
the less errors and warning we get when running it- the better
usually it is something simple like single quotes should be used instead of double quotes
Do we have tools for doing static analysis on the css and html portions as well?
i think that he said all the static testing was for next iteration on other people's projects
<@U0J3A5RML>: yes, we do, at least for css - run `gulp csslint`
<@U0HV4EBMJ>: we are not required to do so, but it is extremely useful as outlined in the lecture today - the second biggest danger is not using them at all :simple_smile:
good point :simple_smile:
or in webstorm if you can setup a gulp task which points to gulpfile to inlcude all of the tasks :simple_smile:
there is actually a separate menu in WebStorm which will list all available gulp tasks for you
did I merge it right or did I break it? lol
looks fine to me
perfect
make sure to remove `'feature/voteeMainPage’` branch
from remote
you can do this by : ```git push origin —delete feature/voteeMainPage```

and then remove locally 

```git branch -D feature/voteeMainPage```
oh, and when I said fine, I meant that the merge looks fine to me. whether or not it breaks the code on `develop` is another story
you should check out develop and test, at least a little bit
it had no conflicts with the code that was there because it was mostly changes to the UI but I will definitely double check
make sure you run ```npm test ``` before merging important things too
it is common practice to test before you push, even if you changes a few lines
yeah I did check when I merged before I pushed it back out to develop
